header_summary: Two papers criticized for unrealistic assumptions about Bitcoin's security model, including trustless out-of-band payments. Bitcoin's security relies on nash equilibrium between miners and can be compromised by censorship. LN-like protocols with sufficient CSV can prevent attacks, while most forms of covenant do not address them. Improvement proposals have been made regarding BIP, UR encoding, and deanonymizing techniques on LN. Team records and shares transcripts of specification meetings for public access.

recent_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
recent_posts.summary:
- Two papers criticized for incorrect assumptions about Bitcoin's security model and compromises.
- Assumption of "trustless" payments via oracles or altchains unrealistic and compromises security.
- Bitcoin's security relies on maintaining nash equilibrium between miners, LN-like protocols can prevent attacks.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP now includes a DH cryptosystem, with the receiver sharing a public key.
- This change was made in response to Adam's comments to enhance security.
- The aim is to provide an easy user experience while safeguarding against fund loss.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email highlights the advantages of using the URI version of base64.
- QR codes treat both options as binary data, doubling the density of the QR.
- UR encoding is recommended for efficiency with QR codes and has additional animation capabilities.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email proposes making classic keysend MPP and highlights CLN and LDK's support.
- It suggests implementing this feature in other systems for increased benefit.
- Recipients have the choice to claim a lower amount in MPP payments, with senders considering it sent.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Tony and Bastien discuss deanonymizing techniques on the Lightning Network, focusing on the recipient's deanonymization.
- Bastien explains that while using a mobile wallet, the nodes you connect to know your identity as the sender/recipient.
- Tony raises concerns about the downside of blinded paths for privacy and decentralization on the network.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing their bi-weekly specification meetings this year.
- The records are shared for others and can be accessed at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode manually checks the transcripts for accuracy.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains involves full 'blinding'.
- Security in blinded statechains relies on trusting the server to report partial signatures.
- Party 1 never learns the final signature or message in the case of blinding.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- A new second-layer protocol design called Ark has been released, offering an alternative to the Lightning network.
- Unlike Lightning, Ark uses virtual UTXOs (vTXOs) to enable seamless fund transfers.
- Users can acquire vTXOs or lift their on-chain UTXOs off the chain for anonymous payments.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Wallets can be compromised or lost, making addresses toxic and funds easily lost forever.
- Silent Payments allow safe multiple payments, but addresses should eventually expire to avoid mistakes.
- By adding an expiration field, wallets can provide a safer and more reliable experience.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team patched an exploit that allowed balance creation by manipulating invoices internally.
- Users are urged to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to protect against similar exploits.
- The incident emphasizes the need for additional checks in Lightning applications to prevent tampering.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We are proceeding with the summit plan to validate local reputation algorithms and gather data.
- The plan involves collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:
- The annual specification meeting took place in New York City in late June.
- Attendees attempted to take transcript-style notes, available at the given link.
- The notes aim to capture discussions during the summit, expressing gratitude to attendees and organizers.
